intro: Fumaria densiflora subsp. micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fumitory, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. This subspecies is native to parts of Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable habitats.
